DataElement.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory 1 Fatigue Right Now Score 11 Point Likert Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation rating their fatigue right now, using a 11 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Fatigue Inventory Fatigue Right Now Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9-item questionnaire, developed by Cleeland and Mendoza, designed to assess the severity of fatigue and the impact of fatigue on daily functioning in cancer patients._A question about how an individual rates their fatigue right now._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueDomain.preferredName: BFI Fatigue Rating 11 Point Likert Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard for the subjective scoring of fatigue that ranges from 0: No Fatigue to 10: Fatigue As Bad As You Can Imagine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0 on a fatigue scale that ranges from 0: No Fatigue to 10: Fatigue as bad as you can imagine.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 0 on a fatigue scale that ranges from 0: No Fatigue to 10: Fatigue as bad as you can imagine.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: BFI Scoring
ReferenceDocuments.description: A global fatigue score can be obtained by averaging all the items on the BFI.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Please rate your fatigue (wea
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please rate your fatigue (weariness, tiredness) by circling the one number that best describes your fatigue right NOW.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.
